plants.name: Cyclamen persicum
plants.description: A tuberous herbaceous perennial plant, Cyclamen persicum produces charming upswept, heart-shaped flowers that bloom in shades of white, pink, and magenta with darker markings. It thrives in Mediterranean climates and is often found blooming indoors or in gardens during autumn.
plants.funFact: The flower petals are reflexed backwards giving the flower a delicate, butterfly-like appearance.

plants.name: Rudbeckia hirta
plants.description: A hardy biennial or short-lived perennial wildflower, Black-eyed Susan is characterized by bright yellow ray florets surrounding a dark brown central disc. It often blooms late summer through autumn, adding vibrant color to meadows and prairies in North America.
plants.location: Native to North America, widespread in meadows and gardens
plants.funFact: Black-eyed Susans are the state flower of Maryland and widely used in pollinator-supportive plantings.

plants.name: Nerine bowdenii
plants.description: This South African bulb produces clusters of showy, pink to salmon funnel-shaped flowers with wavy petals during autumn, often after the foliage has died back. It is cultivated in mild climates and celebrated for autumn garden color.
plants.location: Native to South Africa; cultivated in Mediterranean and temperate gardens
plants.funFact: Nerine bowdenii was named after the collector Harry Bowden‚Äôs daughter, Nerine.

plants.name: Chrysanthemum morifolium
plants.description: Highly popular garden shrubs, Chrysanthemums bloom profusely in various forms and colors during autumn. They are widely cultivated globally and often symbolize autumn in temperate regions.
plants.location: Cultivated worldwide; native to East Asia
plants.funFact: Chrysanthemums are often associated with death and funerals in some cultures, while in others they symbolize life and rebirth.
